item.title: Why Trump’s Reversal on Greenland Still Leaves Europe on EdgeWhy Trump’s Reversal on Greenland Still Leaves Europe on Edge
item.description: Andrew Ross Sorkin, editor at large of DealBook, describes how leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos remain on edge after President Trump, for now, backed down from threats of using tariffs or military force to gain Greenland. ]]>

item.title: Trump Sues JPMorgan, Saying the Bank Closed His Accounts for Political Reasons
item.description: The lawsuit says Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan’s chief executive, directed the bank to put Mr. Trump and some of his businesses on a “blacklist.” ]]>

item.title: Here’s Who Just Bought TikTok
item.description:
Several big companies and investment firms are part of the new American TikTok. Many have ties to one another and President Trump.

]]>

item.title: Will I Have to Download a New TikTok App? And Other Big Questions About The Deal.

item.title: After TikTok Deal, Chinese Firms Search for a New Global Path
item.description: The short-video platform TikTok, owned by ByteDance, has become a geopolitical football in relations between the United States and China. ]]>

item.title: Storm Poses Big Threats to Power Grids Across U.S.

item.title: What to Know About New Rules for 401(k) ‘Catch-Up’ Contributions in 2026
item.description:
Older high-income workers who make contributions beyond the standard amount will have to put that extra money into a Roth 401(k). That may lower their take-home pay.

]]>

item.title: Low Rates Sound Great. But a Trump Fed Could Cause a Painful ‘Sugar High.’
item.description:
Dropping rates more than conditions warrant would stimulate the economy in the short term but could lead to trouble, our columnist says.

]]>
